This is a message that us anti-war cyber activists are spreading around the net to stop the siege of iraq...
 
 ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 A problem is solved effectively when all sides win. It was clear to many of us that starting war with Iraq would increase the likelihood of more global terrorism. However ,we were unable to stop that action before it started. Now that it has begun, we must now rally behind something else effective as well. May America declare an immediate cease-fire, and let negotiations continue, allow civilians and any defectors to find shelter, and encourage Iraq to surrender peacefully.
 
 We call on an IMMEDIATE CEASE FIRE. We have shown our superiority. We do NOT need to traumatize an ENTIRE POPULATION. We are now giving Baghdad their own 911, and they are now in shock and awe like we were on Sept 11, 2001.
 
 PLEASE DO NOT MARCH OUR FORCES INTO BAGHDAD! This will cause immense casualties on BOTH sides. This is UNNECCESARY to the problem at hand.
 
 This DOES NOT SOLVE THE PROBLEM OF TERRORISM. It only fuels the fire of irrational politicians on BOTH SIDES.
 
 SPREAD THE WORD. SUPPORT THE LIVES OF OUR TROOPS. CALL OFF THE UNNECCESARY ASSAULT ON BAGHDAD.
 
 THOUSANDS OF LIVES CAN BE SPARED. 
 
 We take this stand to PREVENT TERRORISM and to SUPPORT our troops.
 
 It is the irrational politician who exploits the men and women of service. It is them that put our troops in harm's way UNNECCESARILY.
 
 
 We do NOT RALLY against our soldiers. We DEFEND them . Bombs hurt and maim soldiers just like they do anyone else. It is NOT OK when ONE soldier dies.
 
 
 Immediately lift sanctions against Iraq and let humanitarian aid flow quickly into the country. Let's immediately rebuild IRAQ. Let's help them win.
 
 Please spread the word. This idea of global military containment is the FALSE New World Order. The new era of global arrangement and the TRUE New World Order is ALL SIDES WINNING ALL THE TIME.
 
 All problems are solved effectively when all sides win all the time.
 
 This may be a war of FUNDAMENTALIST VS FUNDAMENTALIST, and that is NOT our war. There way of thinking is OLD and OUTDATED. Their formula seeks many losers and only one or two winners. They use deception and the poker bluff to solve problems in the world. False information never helps to solve the problem.
 
 This is a war of information. So we fight on BBS, newsgroups, and emails. Come join us.
 
 Please come attend at 
 
 
 http://www.highintelligence.com 
 
 Bubblefish
 ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Yes, you're right, we'll save thousands when we take out Saddam. Little too late... you should have had this talk with Saddam before he killed 1.5 million of his own people.

well 2 million if you count the Kurds as his own, but sure lets go hold hands with Sadam and Osama, lets join arms with China, and I can asure you that just as soon as we turn our back we will find a thousand knives in it. I say that this idea is wishful thinking, I can just see us holding hands accross Baghdad, and then another 9/11 hits, then we try to hold hand for the sake of peace, then they make demands (like males wearing beards and females covering from head to toe) and ofcourse for the sake of peace we obey, then they enslave us and we live miserably ever after, but in "peace"
 
 Or... We solve the problems at hand the way that has always worked(not holding hands) which is the only way to do this.

What problems will be solved by a dangerous and expensive US occupation of iraq? Already, there is even more anger from muslims against the US. 
 
 Colonisation has its risks and consequences......and war gives the state an awesome opportunity for consolidating power
 
 After all, when "we are at war" there are sacrifices that need to be made like Joint Terrorism Task Forces taking political arrests, knocks (or gunshots) on the door in the middle of the night, tapped telephones, the war on drugs is a war on freedom, and so is this one
Colonization? Name one US territorial aquisition in the past twenty years.
US has alot of political control over bosnia and kosovo right now. But iraq is the first modern colonisation attempt i can think of.
"Peace is no more than an outcome after the fighting has ended." - Heero Yui
Oh, please, nothing in 20 years and we'd start not? YOu know that's absurd.

Aryana,
 It is not like 9/11 over there! Did you know that a women over there was so happy to see our troops, that she waved to them, and the Iraqi soldiers shot her! They consider that treason. That is what we are fighting for! What you are doing right now is treason, but what makes America so great is freedom of speech! The people over there dont have any freedom!Saddam does horrible animal like things to those people! The people over there are allready dead! Saddam is a dictator, not a president. He does not care forhis country at al, he just wants to control it. You really hav no clue watit is like overthere for those people! You have no clue why we are over there do you? We are protecting ourselves! Not only that but we are helping people in Iraq. Did you know that Saddam has these rooms called "rape rooms"? He takes men AND BOYS (8yrs+) gives them guns and tell them to fight! If they refuse to do what he says, he takes the children and brings them to these rape rooms and has his soldiers rape them infront of their parents, andif that doesnt work they torture and kill. Sounds hrrible huh? I f you are o concerned about peace! then you should actually want to go over there and give those poor people peace. Like I said they are allready dead if they are under Saddam's rule.

The Iraqi War will solve NOTHING. Instead, there will be more and more terrorist attacks on the US/UK as those radicals brainwashed by the likes of Hussein & Bin Laden think that the US is launching a war against Islam and start attacking the US. Instead of 1 Bin Laden, there will be 100 Bin Ladens.
Not when they see the celebrations of the Iraqis and democracy spreads.
Broker, you do know that this whole liberator image that the US is working so hard for is not going wel over there. No one is "celebrating".

That is funny, I see it all the time, even Al Jizira (cant spell it) broadcasted the celebrating and then got kicked out of Iraq. Why, if they hate America so much would an Iraqi man, walk 6 miles to tell Marines where PFC. Lynch was being held and then back, and back again? Why would they be helping us if they hate us? Deciding our actions on the basis of "we might make terrorist mad" is about the dumbest thing I have ever heard, we do not give in to people who threaten us, this is America not France. Suppose they start blowing up buildings and demand that we adopt the Muslim religion here and turn into a Theocracy, should we give in to get "peace" which has never been achieved through appeasement, or should we go after them with everything we got. For some reason, people think we cannot win, that they will, they cant win, they do not have the numbers, money, recources or time. There are not an infinite number of these people, otherwise there would be no Isreal left, lets face it, we will win this war.
I've heard people calling this another Vietnam, yet we are two weeks in and right outside of Baghdad.

thistownwilleat-
 
 
Broker, you do know that this whole liberator image that the US is working so hard for is not going wel over there. No one is "celebrating".

 
 60% of Iraq's population LOATHE Saddam Hussein and his regime. Want to know why? Well, if you did a little research, you'd see it's because they're Shia Muslims who've been persecuted the Baath Party ever since it came under control of the country. Liberating more than half of the country's people is more than enough reason to take out Saddam.

Strange how US leaders didn't seem to care about saddam's abuses of power while they were selling him weapons....
 
 And after the Gulf War they punished the iraqi people with blockades and sanctions which led to the deaths of thousands of iraqi children. Now even more children will die.

Aryana- 
 
 You seriously need to do some research from credible sources, because those statements are just plain silly. I mean, geez, isn't it common knowledge that the U.S. supported Saddam a little bit (and that's a very small amount) only in the first few days of his coming to power. Secondly, do you honestly believe the U.S. posted all of those sanctions and blockades?

What prevented Saddam from having a better military? Sanctions!
 
 And US weapons sales were very limited to Iraq. I don't see anyone using US equipment. It's because we didn't sell them much.

"60% of Iraq's population LOATHE Saddam Hussein and his regime."
 
 To be honest I believe this statistic, but I'm curious as to how you, or anybody obtained it...door to door in a country where you are imprisoned for showing disrespect for the leader? Doesn't seem like it's very possible to get a stat like this. Check your source.
 
 And regardless of how they feel about Saddam, no one like their homes and their land to be invaded. No one. And you have to remember, these people are pumped full of propaganda 24 hours a day. They don't know what's going on.

I went to school with Iraqi immigrants, they hated Sadam, they had to flee their country and their parents were XXXXXX that America and the Allies did not invade their country last time. Lets talk numbers, the highest reasonable estimate of civillians casulties caused by the war will be a maximum of 5,000. Even if we kill 5,000 we will save many times that number by removing Sadam, who has killed 2 million of his own people. Lets talk property damage, history shows that the U.S. always rebuilds the lands we destroy, this policy helps us to make enemies friends, look at Japan then and now. From everything I have seen the people of Iraq love our troops invading their homes. I would guess that the stat you just mentioned is wrong, I would guess that 90% hate Sadam, but right now we cannot know.
Oh I don't doubt that that many hate Saddam, I was wondering if he got this stat from somewhere or if he fabricated it.

To be honest I believe this statistic, but I'm curious as to how you, or anybody obtained it...door to door in a country where you are imprisoned for showing disrespect for the leader? Doesn't seem like it's very possible to get a stat like this. Check your source.

 
 Which part of the statistic? The 60% of the Iraqi population part, or the part where 60% hates Saddam? 
 
 
And regardless of how they feel about Saddam, no one like their homes and their land to be invaded. No one. And you have to remember, these people are pumped full of propaganda 24 hours a day. They don't know what's going on.

 
 You don't know that for sure. I'm pretty much 100% that if I lived under a dictatorship like Saddam's where I had to live in fear or every knock on the door, every phone call, everytime I walked outside... Saddam didn't just kill people who spoke against him, he also took random people and killed them for fun. Before the war started, there was a report that a man tried to take his belongings and get out of Baghdad, but Saddam's death squad caught him, tied him to a pole, and forced everyone who passed by to watch as they cut out his tongue and let him bleed to death.
Hmmm sounds like that would make me hate him also.
